revision.text:
[[File:Butan Lewis.svg|thumb|right|220px|Acyclic aliphatic/non-aromatic compound ([[butane]])]] [[File:Cyclobutane2.svg|thumb|right|170px|Cyclic aliphatic/non-aromatic compound ([[cyclobutane]])]]
In [[organic chemistry]], [[hydrocarbon]]s ([[chemical compound|compounds]] composed solely of [[carbon]] and [[hydrogen]]) are divided into two classes: [[Aromaticity|aromatic compounds]] and '''aliphatic compounds''' ({{IPAc-en|ˌ|æ|l|ᵻ|ˈ|f|æ|t|ᵻ|k}}; G. ''aleiphar'', fat, oil), also known as non-aromatic hydrocarbons. Aliphatics can be [[cyclic compound|cyclic]]; however, hydrocarbons with conjugated pi-systems that obey [[Hückel's rule]] are instead considered to be [[Aromaticity|aromatic]].<ref>{{GoldBookRef |title=aliphatic compounds |file=A00217 |year=1995}}</ref> Aliphatic compounds can be [[Saturated and unsaturated compounds|saturated]], like [[hexane]], or unsaturated, like [[hexene]] and [[hexyne]]. [[Open-chain compound]]s (whether straight or branched) contain no rings of any type, and are thus aliphatic.
== Structure ==
Aliphatic compounds can be [[Saturated and unsaturated compounds|saturated]], joined by single bonds ([[alkane]]s), or unsaturated, with double bonds ([[alkene]]s) or triple bonds ([[alkyne]]s). Besides [[hydrogen]], other elements can be bound to the [[Catenation|carbon chain]], the most common being [[oxygen]], [[nitrogen]], [[sulphur]], and [[chlorine]].
The least complex aliphatic compound is [[methane]] (CH<sub>4</sub>).
== Properties ==
Most aliphatic compounds are [[Flammability|flammable]], allowing the use of [[hydrocarbon]]s as [[fuel]], such as [[methane]] in [[Bunsen burner]]s and as [[liquefied natural gas]] (LNG), and [[ethyne]] ([[acetylene]]) in [[welding]].
== Examples of aliphatic compounds / non-aromatic ==
The most important aliphatic compounds are:
* n-, iso- and cyclo-alk'''an'''es (saturated hydrocarbons) * n-, iso- and cyclo-alk'''en'''es and -alk'''yn'''es (unsaturated hydrocarbons).
Important examples of low-molecular aliphatic compounds can be found in the list below (sorted by the number of carbon-atoms):
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Formula || Name || Structural Formula || Chemical Classification |- | CH<sub>4</sub> || [[Methane]] || [[File:Methane-2D-stereo.svg|75px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>2</sub> || [[Acetylene]] || [[File:Ethyne-2D-flat.png|75px]] || Alkyne |- | C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>4</sub> || [[Ethylene]] || [[File:Ethene structural.svg|75px]] || Alkene |- | C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub> || [[Ethane]] || [[File:Ethan Lewis.svg|75px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>4</sub> || [[Propyne]] || [[File:Propyne-2D-flat.png|75px]] || Alkyne |- | C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>6</sub> || [[Propene]] || [[File:Propen21.PNG|100px]] || Alkene |- | C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub> || [[Propane]] || [[File:Propane-2D-flat.png|100px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>6</sub> || [[1,2-Butadiene]] || [[File:Buta-1,2-dien.svg|100px]] || Diene |- | C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>6</sub> || [[1-Butyne]] || [[File:Ethylacetylene.svg|100px]] || Alkyne |- | C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>8</sub> || [[1-Butene]] || [[File:But-1-ene-2D-skeletal.png|65px]] || Alkene |- | C<sub>4</sub>H<sub>10</sub> || [[Butane]] || [[File:Butane-2D-flat.png|100px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>10</sub> || [[Cyclohexene]] || [[File:Cyclohexen - Cyclohexene.svg|40px]] || Cycloalkene |- | C<sub>5</sub>H<sub>12</sub> || [[N-Pentane|''n''-pentane]] || [[File:Pentan Skelett.svg|75px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>14</sub> || [[Cycloheptane]] || [[File:Cycloheptane.svg|50px]] || Cycloalkane |- | C<sub>7</sub>H<sub>14</sub> || [[Methylcyclohexane]] || [[File:Methylcyclohexane.png|75px]] || Cyclohexane |- | C<sub>8</sub>H<sub>8</sub> || [[Cubane]] || [[File:Cuban.svg|75px]] || Octane |- | C<sub>9</sub>H<sub>20</sub> || [[Nonane]] || [[File:Nonan Skelett.svg|100px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>12</sub> || [[Dicyclopentadiene]] || [[File:Di-Cyclopentadiene ENDO & EXO V.2.svg|125px]] || Diene, Cycloalkene |- | C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> || [[Phellandrene]] || [[File:Phellandrene alpha.svg|50px]][[File:Phellandrene beta.svg|50px]] || Terpene, Diene Cycloalkene |- | C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> || [[α-Terpinene]] || [[File:Alpha-Terpinene Structure V.1.svg|90px]] || Terpene, Cycloalkene, Diene |- | C<sub>10</sub>H<sub>16</sub> || [[Limonene]] || [[File:(R)-Limonen.svg|50px]][[File:(S)-Limonen.svg|50px]] || Terpene, Diene, Cycloalkene |- | C<sub>11</sub>H<sub>24</sub> || [[Undecane]] || [[File:Undecan Skelett.svg|125px]] || Alkane |- | C<sub>30</sub>H<sub>50</sub> || [[Squalene]] || [[File:Squalene.svg|125px]] || Terpene, Polyene |- |C<sub>2n</sub>H<sub>4n</sub> || [[Polyethylene]] || [[File:Polyethylene_repeat_unit.svg|75px]] || Alkane |}
